name: vscode-nexterminal
description: Unified SSH, Serial, and Port Forwarding hub for VS Code. Manage remote servers, serial devices, and TCP tunnels from a single sidebar with connection multiplexing, a settings panel, macro editor, and regex-based terminal highlighting.

viewsWelcome.contents:
No servers or serial devices configured.
[Add Profile](command:nexus.profile.add)
[Scan Serial Ports](command:nexus.serial.listPorts)

Use the **+** button above to add a tunnel.
Right-click a tunnel to start, stop, or edit it.

No server selected.
Right-click a connected server â†’ "Browse Files" to start.

No macros defined.
[Add Macro](command:nexus.macro.add)
Macros send predefined text to the active terminal.

nexus.logging.maxFileSizeMb.markdownDescription: Maximum size of each Nexus log file in MB before rotation.

nexus.logging.maxRotatedFiles.markdownDescription: How many rotated log files Nexus keeps per log stream.

nexus.logging.sessionTranscripts.markdownDescription: Log session transcripts for SSH and serial connections by default. Can be overridden per profile.

nexus.logging.sessionLogDirectory.markdownDescription: Directory for session transcript logs. Leave empty to use the default extension storage location.

nexus.tunnel.defaultConnectionMode.markdownDescription: Default SSH connection mode for tunnels.
enumDescriptions: Each TCP client gets its own SSH connection (use only when connection isolation is critical)
All clients share a single SSH connection (recommended â€” works with 2FA, lower resource usage)

nexus.tunnel.defaultBindAddress.markdownDescription: Default bind address for reverse tunnels. Use `127.0.0.1` for local-only or `0.0.0.0` for all interfaces (requires `GatewayPorts` on the SSH server).

nexus.ssh.multiplexing.enabled.markdownDescription: Share a single SSH connection per server across terminals, tunnels (shared mode), and SFTP. Reduces overhead and avoids multiple auth prompts. Requires window reload to take effect.

nexus.ssh.multiplexing.idleTimeout.markdownDescription: Seconds to keep an idle multiplexed connection alive after all channels close (`0` = keep alive until window closes, max `3600`). Requires window reload.

nexus.terminal.openLocation.markdownDescription: Where to open SSH and serial terminals.

nexus.terminal.keyboardPassthrough.markdownDescription: Pass Ctrl+ key combinations through to the terminal instead of VS Code when the terminal is focused. Enables full use of terminal apps like nano, vim, and htop.

nexus.terminal.passthroughKeys.markdownDescription: Which Ctrl+ key combinations to pass through when `#nexus.terminal.keyboardPassthrough#` is enabled. Each entry is a letter (e.g. `b` for Ctrl+B).

slot.description: Deprecated. Use keybinding instead. Legacy slot (0-9) auto-migrates to keybinding on first load.
slot.deprecationMessage: Use keybinding instead. Slots are auto-migrated to keybinding on first load.

secret.description: Hide macro value in sidebar/pickers. Note: if the remote side echoes input, it can still appear in terminal output and transcripts.

nexus.terminal.macros.markdownDescription: Terminal macros â€” predefined text sequences sent to the active terminal. Access via `Alt+S` quick pick or assign a `keybinding` (e.g., `alt+m`, `alt+shift+5`, `ctrl+shift+a`) to trigger directly. Supports Alt, Alt+Shift, and Ctrl+Shift modifier groups with A-Z and 0-9 keys.

nexus.terminal.highlighting.enabled.markdownDescription: Enable regex-based pattern highlighting in SSH and serial terminal output. Matches are coloured inline using ANSI SGR codes while respecting existing remote colours.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern to match in terminal output.

color.description: Named colour (red, green, brightCyan, â€¦) or raw SGR code number (e.g. "31").

bold.description: Apply bold style to matched text.

underline.description: Apply underline style to matched text.

nexus.terminal.highlighting.rules.markdownDescription: Highlighting rules applied to SSH and serial terminal output. Each rule specifies a regex `pattern`, a `color` (named or SGR code), optional `flags`, and optional `bold`/`underline` styles. Text already coloured by the remote program is never re-highlighted.

nexus.sftp.cacheTtlSeconds.markdownDescription: How long SFTP directory listings are cached (in seconds). Set to `0` to disable caching entirely (every tree expansion fetches fresh data).

nexus.sftp.maxCacheEntries.markdownDescription: Maximum number of directory listings kept in the SFTP cache. Oldest entries are evicted when this limit is exceeded.

nexus.sftp.autoRefreshInterval.markdownDescription: Auto-refresh interval for the SFTP File Explorer (in seconds). Set to `0` to disable. Only polls when the view is visible and a server is connected.

scripts.build: npm run clean && npm run compile && node esbuild.mjs
scripts.build:production: npm run clean && npm run compile && node esbuild.mjs --production
